final_answer:
The humor and satire in this image arise from juxtaposing two contrasting airport scenarios. 

On the left, a silhouette person confidently walks through an airport terminal, seemingly embarking on a smooth and efficient journey. This part of the image is labeled "YES," suggesting the expectation of a typical, hassle-free airport experience.

On the right, labeled "BUT," the scene shifts to a comic panel showing people affected by a flight delay. One woman is sleeping on her luggage on the airport floor, while a man is lying on seats. This comic highlights the common, often frustrating reality of airport delays, contrasting with the idealized travel depicted on the left.

The humor lies in the discrepancy between the expectation of seamless travel and the frequent reality of delays, making a witty commentary on air travel experiences.
